catalysts.thesis: Classic 'Cluster Buying' signal where the CEO, CFO, and a Director all purchased shares on the open market (filed late Friday, Feb 13), signaling strong internal conviction that the stock is undervalued.
catalysts.catalyst_details: Insider Cluster Buying: CEO, CFO, and Director purchased ~$570k worth of stock on Feb 13, 2026.
catalysts.mispricing_evidence: Stock down 45% YoY; insiders stepping in at these lows suggests a floor.
catalysts.x_sentiment: Bullish chatter on insider tracking accounts

catalysts.thesis: Reported a Q4 earnings beat ($0.97 vs $0.96 est) this morning with positive forward commentary. The stock is up only ~1.8%, leaving room for a PEAD move as the market digests the beat.
catalysts.mispricing_evidence: Beat estimates but price reaction (<2%) is muted compared to historical volatility.

catalysts.thesis: Activist investor Elliott Investment Management has built a ~10% stake, which often precedes strategic shifts, cost-cutting, or sale rumors that drive stock prices higher.
catalysts.mispricing_evidence: Valuation discount relative to peers; activist involvement typically closes this gap.

catalysts.thesis: Director Charles Mathis increased his stake by ~32% (buying 6,000 shares) following an earnings miss, suggesting the sell-off was an overreaction and value is present.
catalysts.mispricing_evidence: Insider buying aggressively into the dip creates a divergence between price action and insider sentiment.
